body_content.explanation: a national park (= a large area of land protected by the government because of its natural beauty or because it has a special history) in the US state of Nevada:
examples: From the 13,000 foot summit of Wheeler Peak to the sage-covered foothills, Great Basin National Park is a place to sample the stunning diversity of the larger Great Basin region.
Below the pass, much of the range lies within the Great Basin National Park, established in 1986.
